Datatable.LocalizationPair: The hardest thing about enhancing this planet was working out how a perfect world could be made even better. Ultimately, your ecologists took a different approach - the planet's mild seasons and lack of significant tectonic activity made it ideal for construction of a series of delicate climate-controlled domes, exhibiting the ecologies of countless other worlds from parched deserts to frozen tundras.
Although the first instinct of the local industry leaders was to plunder the Dust ruins for their riches, long-term thinking prevailed, and they were instead carefully excavated and studied.

Integrating the planet's native people and culture into their society from the start, and acting as guests rather than colonizers, this world's population have become more accepting of others. The multicultural society here is a wonderful working environment for all the myriad species of your empire.
The soil of this planet is so rich in bacteria and nutrients, and so good at promoting plant growth, that it's actually profitable to mine dirt and ship it to other planets in the system.

The planet's bountiful crust has been a blessing for the economy, once the initial lawless free-for-all was reined in. Now, land deeds are correctly recorded, deep-mining operations appropriately regulated, and even most of the original pollution has been cleaned up.

It took a lot of doing, given the frankly murderous pressures involved, but your empire succeeded in constructing an ultra-deep-sea laboratory to study this planet's unique life-forms. People being as they are, it was soon followed by the galaxy's deepest underwater hotel, a lunatic endeavor that has nevertheless been pulling in tourists from far and wide.
Believed to have been formed from the shattered remains of a once-colonized moon, this asteroid band is such a rich source of Dust that it helps fund all the system's new developments.
The remains of the protoplanetary disc, and now laced through with gatherer satellites, this asteroid band provides enough exotic elements for all the system's new developments.

Although new, deeper caves are still being discovered to this day, the majority of the planet's vast caverns have been explored, reinforced, studied, and repurposed for industry, research, housing, or as ready-built deep bunkers for your military.

A rare form of ice that is caused by water crystallizing under high pressures, Ice-10 is interesting for its thermodynamic properties - which have been thoroughly studied, such that the fascinating substance is now a focal point of local industry.

Once a very wet and very difficult environment, a concerted effort to partially terraform the planet has lessened the intensity of the winds and storms - except where they provide bountiful power from wind and hydroelectric generators.

Almost dirt-free, the hard, gleaming surface of this planet used to make agriculture difficult and potentially poisonous. Newly-developed artificial soil microbes not only sequester toxic metal salts from the water, but package and serve them up on a silver platter for local chemical industries.

The gleaming, multi-colored auroras that once caused such headaches have been not only tamed by magnetic shielding, but are now valued by the scientific community as a source of new discoveries in atmospheric sciences. Their beauty, thankfully, remains.

This world's flora and fauna, which grows rapidly to extreme sizes when in a sufficiently dense atmosphere, has been successfully exported to other worlds in the system for nurturing in special pressure-controlled farming complexes.

With an atmosphere that was once saturated by complex chemical compounds, life on this planet was challenging. These days, vast filtration stations ensure that the various psychoactive compounds are available only when they're desirable.

Applying enormous amounts of energy and grappling with gravitational alterations, the previously uncontrollable geothermic activity of the planet is not only manageable, but actually useful since every new factory can have its own dedicated geothermal generator.

By manipulating the magnetic core, stabilizing continental drift, and improving construction techniques, the problems in daily life caused by seismic activity have been largely solved - and on top of this, the active fault-lines work to dredge up Dust from within the planet's upper mantle.

The previously named "killer satellites" are now less like assassins and more like goalkeepers. Thanks to cheap and robust sources of energy and innovations in shield technology, incoming meteors are captured and mined for their valuable Adamantian deposits.
While the beasts of this planet were first described as "giant," "primal," and "impressive," these days the adjectives would tend to "companionable," "obedient," and "just the right size to ride on."

The ruins here have been painstakingly excavated, and are not merely valuable for trade and tourism - the species that once lived here had access to a few scientific discoveries that previously eluded us.
By following the traces of Dust embedded in the world's crust, our scientists have uncovered - and repurposed - the fortified subterranean bases of the Endless that put it there.
This world's carefully-conserved coral reefs are now a symbol of natural beauty recognised galaxy-wide.

The so called "cyber-lichen" turns out to form a natural neural network under certain conditions. This allows for vital components of research mainframes and espionage supercomputers to be grown on agar plates rather than built.

Your scientists have discovered connections between the ecology of the ancient, now-fossilised organisms here and the mineral deposits in the system. Working from this knowledge, new resource veins can be uncovered.
Now that the control codes for the Endless microfactories have been deciphered, they can be programmed to help with local building work as well as food production.

We've finally catalogued exactly which of the absurd profusion of flora on this planet are toxic, allergenic, or violently motile. The gourmet food industry is more diverse than ever, and being an experimental chef requires less hazard pay.
Local architecture has adapted to take advantage of the low gravity - soaring bridges and towering needle-like spires are the order of the day, and all available with low-cost materials.

With the archaeologists' work finally finished, reconstruction and resettlement of the world's deserted cities has begun. Many buildings have been preserved in their original state, as monuments to those who came before.

Refineries built over the planet's miraculous molten springs extract and refine valuable materials from the gouts of white-hot metal - although a few have been left pristine as spectacular (if dangerous) tourist destinations.

The surface of this planet is a riot of cliffs, chasms, ridges, and spikes, now traversed by soaring bridges, pierced with spectacular tunnels - and offering wonderful views to airships full of tourists.

A thorough study of the local geology has revealed ways to trigger the formation of new komatiite volcanoes on demand. Industry leaders now regard the planet's upper mantle as a sort of vending machine: Insert explosives, receive magnesium.
The cities on this planet have been designed with the seasonal weather in mind, so no-one is too hot or too parched in the summer or too cold, wet, or depressed from lack of sunlight in the winter.

Now that all of the knowledge banks and valuable archaeological finds from this planet's bunkers have been extracted, catalogued, stored and studied, the bunkers themselves - miles upon miles of subterranean tunnels - can be repurposed as historically interesting, if unusual, housing.
Orbital habitats have been constructed after the model of opera houses and amphitheatres, to allow everyone to experience the planet's haunting, ethereal song.

Dedicated signal backtracing and code-cracking efforts have revealed the origin of the radio transmissions, although not their purpose - they appear to be nothing but a continual sequence of numbers, spoken in a recorded voice in a language of the Concrete Endless. Speculation abounds as to why.

Archeological studies have revealed the origin and purpose of this world's symmetry: It was once used by the Endless as a setting for planet-scale games of nation development, expansion, and war. The symmetrical structure allowed for both "players" to have identical prospects. Real life, of course, is neither fair nor balanced.
Massive pylons on planet's surface stabilize and direct the natural plasmasphere, giving the entire world a shield equivalent to your strongest bunkers.

The question of the sentience of these vast fields of fluid, reactive Dust have been answered. Although not intelligent on their own, they are able to bond with a Dust-enhanced individual, and boost that person's awareness across the entire planet's surface.
While the source of this Crescent's beneficial effects on artificial life still remain a baffling mystery, we have decided that even if we can't understand it, we can certainly exploit it.

The Dust-attracting substances of this Crescent have been identified, and although we don't have enough of the raw materials to deploy them everywhere, we've made the best possible use of what we had and turned this Crescent into a veritable dust bonanza.

The intermittently dematerializing matter of this Crescent has been fully stabilized - but can still be made immaterial again on command. The industrial sectors of the Crescent now make use of machines once considered impossible, with parts moving through each other in an elegant automated ballet.

A pseudo-atmosphere appeared during the creation of this Crescent. The way light passes through it creates unique visuals, and we've finally found some less-easily-distracted scientists to help study the phenomenon.

For some time, we were justifiably cautious that the remains of the self-replicating Dust experiment here might reactivate and devour the entire system again. After extensive research, we are at last satisfied that the Dust here has been permanently rendered inert, is indistinguishable from normal Dust, and no longer needs to be kept separate from it.
Enhance The Seventeen Thousand Islands Bridge

An archipelago of natural islands that span the gap between planet surface and space, hanging in the darkness like glittering stepping stones, and now covered with some of the galaxy's most desirable (and most well-defended) housing.

Though the local religious sects were strongly against any "defilement" of the ancient structures, they were variously convinced, placated, discredited, or simply ignored. The treasures dug up from within the gardens proved to be well worth the effort, as ships built here can use lightweight hull materials and exotic drive cores not available anywhere else in the galaxy. Certain people still consider these ships to be holy relics.

The enormous spacedocks above the planet, once the greatest shipyard of the concrete Endless, have been partially restored. Although no longer able to build fleets, they provide ample staging posts for troops.

Your species' finest bioengineers have, at last, worked out how to duplicate this magnificent tree - admittedly, only with this planet's unique geology, and only on a much smaller scale. However, on this world at least, buildings and even entire cities can be grown rather than constructed.

A natural anomaly whose probable existence is less than zero, this series of natural quantum-linked transport gates create “tunnels” from the planets’ surfaces to various points in the star system. Now explored and mapped, the smaller and better-concealed slipgates can be used to covertly move troops.
The site of a major engagement between warring empires, the space surrounding this system took years to sweep clear of dangerous debris.
The site of an engagement between enemy fleets, the space surrounding this system took months to sweep clear of dangerous debris.
Little reminder of the previous skirmish remains, even the orbital debris is no longer a nuisance.
A minor civilization that resisted assimilation was conquered here, but only memorials remain.
A thriving pirate colony was laid to waste here, resulting in massive devastation and debris.
There was once a pirate hideout here, but only ruins and debris remain.
A small band of pirates once held this place, but they were driven out and only some debris remains.
An enormous ground battle occurred here, and the planet will forever show the horrific scars.
A ground battle took place here, and the planet is only slowly recovering.
A minor engagement occurred here, but the evidence of battle is already disappearing.
The site of a major engagement between warring empires, now swept clear of dangerous orbital debris. It also provided a wealth of survey data that you used to enhance locally-built ships.
The site of an engagement between enemy fleets, now swept clear of dangerous orbital debris. It also provided some helpful survey data that you used to enhance locally-built ships.
A reminder of a previous skirmish, now swept clear of dangerous orbital debris. It also provided a smidgin of data that you used to enhance locally-built ships.
A minor civilization that resisted assimilation was conquered here, and while no trace of the battles remain, we have since learned better ways of dealing with foreign species.
A thriving pirate colony was laid to waste here. They left behind heavy surface-to-orbit particle cannons that have now been repaired for your own use.
There was once a pirate hideout here. They left behind laser installations that have now been repaired for your own use.
A small band of pirates once held this place. They left behind point defence guns that have now been repaired for your own use.
An enormous ground battle occurred here, and your own military has made good use of the miles of tunnels and bunkers.
A ground battle took place here, and your own military has made good use of the remaining fortifications.
A minor engagement occurred here, and your own military has made good use of the trenches and craters.

A rare form of ice that is caused by water crystallizing under high pressures, Ice-10 is interesting for its thermodynamic properties. A concerted effort by the planet's engineers has led to a lessening of its negative effects.
Once a very wet and very difficult environment, a concerted effort to partially terraform the planet has lessened the intensity of the winds and storms.
Almost dirt-free, the hard, gleaming surface of this planet used to make agriculture difficult and potentially poisonous. Recent improvements in soil development, however, have eased the problem.

The gleaming, multi-colored auroras that once caused such headaches have been partially tamed by magnetic shielding. Fortunately, their beauty remains even though their negative effects have been reduced.

With an atmosphere that was once saturated by complex chemical compounds, life on this planet was challenging. Application of terraforming technologies, however, has rendered the effects of the air less intense.
Applying enormous amounts of energy and grappling with gravitational alterations, the previously uncontrollable geothermic activity of the planet is now somewhat less intense.
By manipulating the magnetic core, stabilizing continental drift, and improving construction techniques, the problems in daily life caused by seismic activity have been notably reduced.

While the long orbital ellipse remains a fact of life, the application of terraforming sciences, advanced architecture, and improved agriculture has changed it from a health risk into a quaint tourist adventure.

For the first time in the history of the universe, the phrase "killer satellites" actually has a practical meaning. Thanks to cheap and robust sources of energy and heavily shielded orbitals, major meteor threats are neutralized high in the atmosphere.
Controlled global warming, advanced thermo-efficient architecture, and really warm parkas have greatly lessened the negative effects of this anomaly.
Once directed non-baryonic magnetic flux technology was reduced to handheld size, the negative impacts of this anomaly were greatly reduced.
Though it took time, patience, and very large nets, much of the orbital debris that circulated the planet has been removed or dumped planetside for recycling.
Partially by reducing the effects of the fumaroles and partially by hardening the infrastructure, many of the problems caused by this anomaly have been alleviated.
By developing and improving the ozone layer and atmosphere while better insulating construction, a large part of the dangerous effects of this radiation has been removed.
While the beasts of this planet were first described as "giant," "primal," and "impressive," these days the adjectives would tend to "controlled," "manageable," and "delicious."
Though the surface of this planet remains rough, a few engineering projects involving viaducts and tunnels have rendered this problem unimportant. Fortunately, the landscape remains impressive.
The soil of this planet, once sterile and barren, is now much richer in the organic life necessary for agriculture.
By the simple and straightforward process of bleeding excess gravitons across hyperdimensions into a parallel universe, the previously extreme gravity of the planet has been somewhat reduced.
The matter still tends to flicker, but it is now possible to predict these changes rather accurately. No more spontaneous disappearance of ships from construction hangars.
All it took was encouraging the study of the luminous phenomena of this pseudo-atmosphere for the inhabitants of this Crescent to regain their interest in science.
After long and tedious efforts, every defect in the Crescent has been fixed. These all too frequent malfunctions are now just a bad memory.
The uninhabitable section of the Crescent has finally been reworked, everything is back to normal. If the Crescents were something normal in the first place.

Allows Anomaly Reduction
Anomaly Reduction lets you remove the negative effects of a Negative Anomaly

Allows Anomalies Enhancement
Anomaly Enhancement lets you increase the positive effects of a Positive Anomaly
Anomaly Enhancement requires the [ecologistColored] #B0C65D#Ecologists#REVERT# to be the Primary Political Party
Click to select an anomaly improvement for this planet
